Module count
Package count.matek

Class Functions

java.lang.Object
count.matek.Functions
public class Functions
extends Object
Some functions adapted from Numerical Recipes, and other useful calculations.
Since:
November 7, 2003, 2:58 PM
Author:
Miklós Csűrös

    • gammln

      public static final double gammln​(double xx)
      Logarithm of the Gamma function. (based on NR ch.6.1)
      Parameters:
      xx - positive value
      Returns:
      ln(Gamma(x))

    • factorial

      public static final double factorial​(int n)
      (based on NR ch. 6.1)
      Parameters:
      n - non-ngative integer
      Returns:
      the value n! as a floating-point number.

    • factln

      public static final double factln​(int n)
      (based on NR ch. 6.1)
      Parameters:
      n - integer
      Returns:
      ln(n!)

    • bicoln

      public static final double bicoln​(int n, int k)
      Computes ln (n choose k)
      Parameters:
      n -
      k -
      Returns:
      ln (n!/(k!*(n-k)!))

    • powers

      public static final double[] powers​(double base, int max_exponent)
      Computes the powers of some number.
      Parameters:
      base - base for the exponentiation
      max_exponent - maximum value of k for which base^k is computed (inclusive)
      Returns:
      array of [1.0, base, base^2, ..., base^max_exponent]

    • betacf

      public static final double betacf​(double a, double b, double x)
      Used by betai: evaluates continued fraction for incomplete beta function by modifed Lentz's method. (NR ch. 6.4)

    • betai

      public static final double betai​(double a, double b, double x)
      Incomplete beta function.
      Parameters:
      x - must be between 0 and 1 (NR ch. 6.4)

    • Student_t

      public static final double Student_t​(int degrees_of_freedom, double t)
      Returns:
      integral(-t,t) Student_df(x)

    • erfcc

      public static final double erfcc​(double x)
      Complementary error function erfc(x). 
      \frac{2}{\sqrt{\pi}} \int_{x}&{\infty} e^(-t^2) dt
      (NR ch. 6.2)

    • log_erfcc

      public static final double log_erfcc​(double x)

      public static final double gammq​(double a, double x)
      (NR ch. 6.2)
      Returns:
      incomplete gamma function Q(a,x)=1-P(a,x).

    • gammp

      public static final double gammp​(double a, double x)
      (NR ch. 6.2)
      Returns:
      incomplete gamma function P(a,x)

    • gser

      public static final double gser​(double a, double x)
      NR ch. 6.2
      Returns:
      the incomplete gamma function P(a, x) evaluated by its series representation.

    • gcf

      public static final double gcf​(double a, double x)
      (NR. ch 6.2)
      Returns:
      the incomplete gamma function Q(a, x) evaluated by its continued fraction representation

    • Poisson_cumulative

      public static final double Poisson_cumulative​(double lambda, int k)
      Returns:
      the value of \sum_i=0^{k-1} Pr(X=i) where X is distributed by Poisson(lambda).

    • Poisson_tail

      public static final double Poisson_tail​(double lambda, int k)
      Returns:
      the value of \sum_i=k^\infty Pr(X=i) where X is distributed by Poisson(lambda).

    • Chi_square_tail

      public static final double Chi_square_tail​(double nu, double chi_square)
      Probability that chi-square random variable exceeds a particular value
      Parameters:
      nu - number of degrees of freedom
      chi_square - threshold

    • Chi_square_test

      public static final void Chi_square_test​(double[] data, double[] expected, int num_constraints, double[] test_statistic)
      Computes the chi-squared test statistic. Based on Numerical Recipes 14.3
      Parameters:
      data - binned data
      expected - expected values in the bins by the model
      num_constraints - number of constraints that determine the degrees of freedom: if expected is computed from data, then +1, plus number of parameters fitted param test_statistic in lieu of return value, we set this array --- chi-square statistic and P-value (entries 0 and 1)

    • roundToMostSignificantDigit

      public static double roundToMostSignificantDigit​(double x, int[] exact_values)
      Rounds to the closest unit at the given precision.
      Parameters:
      x - the value to be rounded
      exact_values - if not null, then (msd, exponent) pair is put there (must be of length ≥2)
      Returns:

    • roundToMostSignificantDigit

      public static double roundToMostSignificantDigit​(double x, int[] exact_values, boolean round_to_zero)
      Rounds a double to one significant digit (called msd).
      Parameters:
      x - the value to be rounded
      exact_values - if not null, then (msd, exponent) pair is put there (must be of length ≥2)
      round_to_zero - whether we round towards 0 (conversion to int), or to the closest unit
      Returns:
      the rounded value
